revised_title: Reproduction Patterns of House-Mice in Different Environments
tldr: This study examines the reproduction patterns of house-mice living in different environments, such as urban areas, flour buffer depots, cold stores, and corn-ricks. The research found that mice breed throughout the year, with higher productivity rates in corn-ricks and average rates in flour depots and cold stores. Mice in cold stores can breed in cold environments with temperatures never more than 15°F all year round. The study also provides insights into the mice's weight, sex ratio, and pregnancy rates in various habitats.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
